website_summaries.verdict: The best budget filter to choose when you need great performance and filtration.
pros: High build quality at a smaller price point
The gasket does a better job of filtering many types of motor oils compared to other budget options that leave the oil less effective
cons: Lacks certain parts that are required for brand-specific compatibility with some models

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 6 of these filters in the last 2 years as myself and my kids all drive hondas. An hour ago I changed the oil in my car for the 20th time, (135K), and I had to clean up 4 qts of oil all over my driveway from the filter seal letting go within 30 seconds of me starting the car. It went on like the threads inside were wrong or crooked and didnt seal after it was installed. I grabbed the old filter out of the trash and it installed perfectly so something was definitely wrong with this one. I just wont be buying another that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McG

customer_reviews.title: Superb filter for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Long time ago use to use the orange can oil filter until I started really trying to take care of my cars. If you look around on the internet you will find there are people that have taken apart oil filters and compared the insides. This one rates fairly well with having a bunch of filtering material, good flow with a good bypass valve design. If you use this filter with good synthetic oil and top tier gas your oil should come out very "clean" which should translate to longer engine life.
customer_reviews.author: eeeper

customer_reviews.title: excellent value / excellent filter / excelkent vendor
customer_reviews.text: Did a controlled experiment. Eight Thousand mile synthetic oil and filter change...2017 Honda CR-V 1.5. This engine is turbo charged. Always have oil and filter analyzed by Blackstone labs.... 44 thousand miles on vehicle....oil changed between 5 and 8 thousand miles. This Bosch filter still had lots of rated particle mass hiding capability. Up to the task for sure. No chance of bypassing any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: gentry

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 2017 Nissan Frontier, but it leaked oil. So did a Fram aftermarket. I finally settled on the Nissan 15208-9E01A Oil Filter even though the Amazon Check Fit app said it did not fit. It worked with no leaks. Probably because the Nissan filter has an O-ring seal whereas the Bosch and Fram both use a flat rubber washer. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: gem hunt

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Bosch premiums are great filters, and are made in the USA. (See photo). Sturdy, well made filter with steel center core and endcaps. 99% filtration. Silicone anti drainback instead of rubber. Amazon seems to have the best price when you consider prime shipping. Saves money and offers better filtration than most filters that cost more. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ideas

customer_reviews.title: Wow best filter ever, say everyone with Zero proof ever!
customer_reviews.text: OK so it's an oil filter. It does what it says just like every other filter ever. Sure, some people say it's the best filter they've ever used. Really though how do they know? I've used about every brand possible in my life and I've never had a "failure" from any of them so therefore the only conclusion a sane person (like me) can come to is that they all pretty much do what they say they will do. So, in conclusion get this or that or whatever is cheapest or most expensive cause it probably doesn't matter anyway.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeExample

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I use this number on my Nissan ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I use this number on my Nissan Altima ,Titan, and Pathfinder. It made for the Titan V-8 5.6 engine, but it also will fit the 2.4 and 3.6 , just longer in length. That's why I use this number filter, I believe the bigger the more oil cleaning..I change my own oil and never had a problem with this filter, I like Bosch products
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W. Martin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, the oil filter is...
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced my Synthetic oil and oil filter last Saturday. Drove my Nissan Frontier Crewcab 2000 for four days now. So far, it has been running smoothly and quietly. It has been 100 miles since the oil change. I have been driving a combination of local roads and highways.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well!
customer_reviews.text: I having been using this filter in conjunction with Castrol High Mileage Full Synthetic. Seems to be doing its job, keeps the oil clean and free of harmful fowling. The filter itself is built well and affordable. I cant say how hard it is to screw in or out, I have my oil changes done at the shop, I just bring the oil and filter. I think I remember reading somewhere that this is the filter that Castrol recommends with their oil.
customer_reviews.author: Fin

customer_reviews.title: These are EXCELLENT filters, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.text: These are EXCELLENT filters, especially for the money. I actually can't believe how little I paid for these on Amazon for the quality you get. I used to buy Honda OEM filters when they were still being manufactured by Filtech (A01 filters). However, these A01 filters have dried up for the most part, and are now mostly the inferior A02 filters, which I believe are made by Fram. Since then, I have bought these in bulk, and the quality is excellent. I will be sticking with these going forward.
customer_reviews.author: cyak1551

customer_reviews.title: A great Oil filter.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best oil filter i found for my Honda CR-V 2007. Just turned 100K. Even the best oil is worthless with a Cheap Oil filter. Filters are much smaller than 20 years ago on a big V-8. So you need the best. Its what's inside! The Media and how much. The Orange color one has about 1/3 less inside. Bosch is the way to go. Full protection. 7500 miles you want the best filter.
customer_reviews.author: ASE master tech Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly for 2007 Honda Accord despite amazon fit check not recommending (sometimes you need to search company website for correct model). Reasonably priced compare to FRAM garbage filter. I’ll keep buying as long as I own vehicle
customer_reviews.author: El

customer_reviews.title: broken ring
customer_reviews.text: lately did an oil change on cr-v. took it for drive afterwards. when I came back saw a pool of oil on the ground. jacked up and checked: it's coming from oil filter, pulled it off and the ring dropped off - it's broken. it's not made in good quality at all. Although I've used a few times with the same filters just fine, can't risk with this defect if it happens just once - engine can be totaled if not knowing the oil level is low.
customer_reviews.author: S7 user

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gone through 6 of these on my 2009 Acura TL and 2009 Honda Accord and these are great! Honda dealer was closed so I had to get alternatives, and these are definitely better than OEM parts. Casing is sturdy, holds up after 10,000 miles, and of course it’s a well recognized brand. Will keep using this brand on my cars
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Built on consistency
customer_reviews.text: Given the nature of this product it’s not easy to evaluate the effectiveness of it. The package arrived promptly. It is as described. I chose Bosch because all other products made by the same brand have never disappointed me whether it be windshield wipers, dish washers or power tools. The quality is always there. This company has built a good reputation and a trusted one.
customer_reviews.author: Dinguskon

customer_reviews.title: Great part that worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Great part that went on perfectly for my 2005 Honda Civic Ex 1.7 L Coupe. I had to put that in there because way too many reviews don't have that important piece of information that make reading reviews important in the first place. When I read reviews, I look for the ones that pertain to my specific situation. So thank you to whoever puts what car they used it on it the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Mr and Mrs Mahorn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter, great price - use for convential, blend, or synthetic oil
customer_reviews.text: This is my new "go to" filter. I use this specific one on my 2007 Honda Civic with Syn-blend oil at 5000 mi changes and on a 2012 Honda Pilot with full synthetic oil at 8000mi changes for my Pilot. Wix filter (excellent too) was my go to before, but with Bosch easier to find, get a bunch of them when they are on sale here to save $ and still get an excellent filter.
customer_reviews.author: MWEND

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Great product. Bosch trusted!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for, an excellent pil filter at an extremely affordable price. Bosch is an extremely reliable bran and I highly recommend others to use them for their oil filter needs, as well as other products. This filter is a little thinner (but taller) than most other filters and seems to have a more unique hex shape, so you may need to purchase a new tool for removing this one. However the old fashion way worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Do not have good luck with Bosch
customer_reviews.text: Do not have good luck with Bosch. I received incorrect Bosch oil filter. Box listed Bosch 3323 filter but inside the box I found Bosch 3332 filter. Dislexia in quality control. Last year I ended replacing 1.5 year old Bosch battery that failed. I remember Robert Bosch used to make best quality products. Not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: vypredaj

customer_reviews.title: Bosch Premium
customer_reviews.text: This name alone is enough. I have used a few filters and cut them open and Bosch has proven top quality and consistency with more filter paper inside and thicker a canister, so for me, this is the only filter I use now.
customer_reviews.author: Kxriss

customer_reviews.title: And the price is very nice as well considering what you’d pay for it at ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to switch from synthetic blend to full synthetic and I needed a top notch oil filter to keep my oil filter efficiently. This filter is a no brainer especially if you’re running full synthetic but works with conventional oil as well. And the price is very nice as well considering what you’d pay for it at an auto part store. #misterrogersapproved
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. RogersTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: I've bought three of these filters by now. Supposedly they are identical to the PureOne filers. They work and appear to be well constructed. I've used them on a 2007 Honda Fit (L15A1) and 2009 Honda Civic Si(K20Z3). No problems so far. I should mention that I don't cut open and analyze my filters, so I cannot speak to the material inside the filter. They are highly recommended on the forums.
customer_reviews.author: jsm

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a very nice filter for the $, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: These filters are of a solid construction and have preformed well for me. I have put around 10k miles on 2 of these in 2 different vehicles and they are both running great.
customer_reviews.author: MenAtTwerk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value in a quality part
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a terrific price. Better flow characteristics than the OEM part. What's not to like? Have cut open Bosch Wix and OEM parts. Bosch uses quality internal components. Have had zero oil-related engine issues over several years with either Bosch or WIX filters.
customer_reviews.author: Car_Guy_in_So.CA

customer_reviews.title: Great oil filter but description does not match product.
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this filter it stated that the upper gasket was made out of silicone but it wasn't. No worries, the anti drain valve is made out of silicone and the filter media is made out of silicone blend so it's still a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Alamo

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2012 Honda Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2012 Honda Odyssey perfectly. Be sure to rub a little bit of new oil on the seal and threads and you'll be good to go! I have had no leaks or oil pressure issues. This filter works well with my Odyssey that requires 0W-20 synthetic oil. I'll stick with this filter moving forward!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: A high quality oil filter
customer_reviews.text: This has all high quality components, much better than FRAM filters and everybit as high quality as OEM. For the price of these filters on Amazon, better get a few of these. I use these filters on all of my Honda's oil changes.
customer_reviews.author: Spanky

customer_reviews.title: Best Oil Filters for My Accord
customer_reviews.text: Will buy again in larger quantities to save money and not have to go to local auto part stores. Works as expected as long as you follow the recommended oil changes of 5000 miles or 5 months, which every comes first.
customer_reviews.author: LGG

customer_reviews.title: Bosch quality beats all other filters!
customer_reviews.text: My previous experience was always good with these filters though I never looked into it much. These are truly excellent quality oil filters. This filter was double the capacity of the premium filter that my local oil change place uses. Glad I decided to do my own oil this time around. Bosch is the only filter I will ever use. Research has shown these are quality filters.
customer_reviews.author: Travis H.

customer_reviews.title: solid filter
customer_reviews.text: i used K&N filters for many years. noted the recent reviews showing leakage around the bolt at the filter end even when not used for installation. tried this bosch filter. installed just as easily as the K&N filter. seems to work fine. have 125,000 miles on an acura mdx.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Good brand, fit perfectly. Always do your research on filters, they are not made the same and from a former engine tech, bad filters are the cause of a ton of engine wear. Cheap ones tend to have the media disintegrate, come loose, internal seals go bad, drainback valves rip, etc. Bosch is one of the brands I've never seen those issue with.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas C.

customer_reviews.title: Fits CR-V
customer_reviews.text: First choice would have been 15400-PLM-A01, but since they are hard to find, and 15400-PLM-A02 is actually FRAM, I am going to go with Bosch. So far so good, no leaks. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: emeron

customer_reviews.title: Bosch Incorrect size
customer_reviews.text: This filter was too large for my 2008 Honda Accord 4 cylinder. It leaked a little bit. All other brands make the filter smaller since it's a 4 cylinder. I learned the hard way after 5000 miles! Never buying another from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M Haroon Jamshed

customer_reviews.title: Bosch 3323 Premium FILTECH Oil Filter
customer_reviews.text: It fits my 2001 Accord V6 but its size is little bit smaller than my original filter. Definitely will not buy again, not the quality problem but the size is smaller. I prefer larger filter, at least the same size of the original.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works on my Odyssey!
customer_reviews.text: Great filter! I have used it religiously for my 2014 Honda Odyssey Touring. Have had no issues with it and keep buying more when I run out. It's a great OEM replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ha

customer_reviews.title: the filter works great! It's my go-to for every oil change
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my 2005 Outback XT. I know Amazon says it's not compatible, but they act as a major upgrade to the stock filter. (I suggest you look into it if you have Subaru's 2.5T engine.) Anyway, the filter works great! It's my go-to for every oil change. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jesse (/|O|\)

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: I have used three of these now, a much better filter than other brands. You want to get a good filter, saving a dollar or two is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mt Spurr

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: The Bosch filter is a great alternative to the OEM Honda filter made by Purolator. Much better quality than Fram and a perfect fit for my 2005 CR-V with the 2.4L K24 engine. The price can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Jeb

customer_reviews.title: Quality for Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Changed the oil on my car and cannot get better value than Bosch. I used the site camelcamelcamel to track the pricing of the oil filters and have ordered them for the next 30,000 miles. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: taaronjones

customer_reviews.title: 2014accord sport.
customer_reviews.text: 2014 accord sport. Perfect fit. This filter is about 10 bucks locally. Seems like it's new not dented. Will buy again for that price. ********update. 10.27.18. I was gonna buy another one for honda pilot but this is now only available for prime members. I'm gonna drop it to 1 start now.
customer_reviews.author: Big abe

customer_reviews.title: High quality and low price.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these oil filters for years with trouble. For the money it's the best quality filter. Would gladly recommend to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa W.

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: What’s not to like about this filter? 10 X better then the piece of crap Fram filters!! Since Honda went to Honeywell, aka: Fram, I have gone with these superior filters!
customer_reviews.author: perfsmrf

customer_reviews.title: I use this filter every oil change on my 2006 ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this filter every oil change on my 2006 civic. I have seen videos of these filters cut open and they compete with the higher end oil filters because they use the same components and similar material and it's cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Been using this filter on a 2015 Honda Pilot and 2015 Honda Odyssey for a couple of years now. I am no expert on oil filters, but this one does the job and is a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Daron L Janis

customer_reviews.title: Great oil filter for the price.
customer_reviews.text: After watching some online filter comparisons I decided to go with this for my Frontier. Been using them for a while. They're great filters. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: cscky

customer_reviews.title: poor shipment
customer_reviews.text: bag not sealed pull tape still on inner bag ,Note bag came in the form of a ball
customer_reviews.author: kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for you do it yourself guys and gals. No issues so far and great value.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money
customer_reviews.text: Best value for money filter - works as it should and has good quality. This one is made by filtech for Bosch, which make it probably the same as the oem filter
customer_reviews.author: Doron G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This is my fourth oil change with this filter and it has never given me any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sharad Tiwari

customer_reviews.title: Its BOSCH
customer_reviews.text: I have not opened one of these up and would not know what I am looking for even if I did. But I assume it is a great product as my vehicle has not blown up yet?
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: No box or plastic seal
customer_reviews.text: The filter came with no box and had no plastic seal covering it. It was quite dirty and has some dust building up. I just threw the filter away and went to my local auto zone. The price was good but I rather not waste time returning a cheap item and have them ship it to someone who's changing their oil for the first time. Make sure filters come undamaged and have a plastic film covering the threading.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Simple oil filter
customer_reviews.text: Would like to see the nut on the end for removal. My vehicle is tight quarters and that simple change would make life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Reaume

customer_reviews.title: Great Oil filter for Nissan and Honda
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this filter on my Nissan Titan and my Honda Odyssey. Great value for the money. Much better than OEM filters
customer_reviews.author: Abarmard

customer_reviews.title: does fit 08 Xterra
customer_reviews.text: ill leave a more detailed review when i buy another filter after an oil change to see how much this filter actually filters. but it does fit an 08 nissan xterra
customer_reviews.author: Dariel.C

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This filter is always ranked very high in comparisons when it comes to "value". I have found it works the best without spending $10+.
customer_reviews.author: JimMortgage

customer_reviews.title: reasonably good filter
customer_reviews.text: rubber grips to help hold the filter would have been nice. filters fine.
customer_reviews.author: jason y.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used it with synthetic oil on my Honda Odyssey 2006. It looks very good condition in and out side of the filter after 10k miles.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good value, fits a 2001 kia sportage
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this on a 2001 kia sportage fit perfectly will update this in a couple of months to give a full review but as of now perfect fit no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie30

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these in my cars for the last 2 years now, it is my go to oil filter. It has a better filtration system than the cheaper filters.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2019 civic
customer_reviews.text: Using it on my 2019 Civic Si. First oil/filter change. Won't know much until I have to change it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Defect in packaging for 3323?
customer_reviews.text: Filter looked very nicely made, however it was covered in a dusty sediment which might be from shipping. Compared it to a Wix XP and it's slightly longer than the Wix. Looks nearly identical to a Motorcraft that was just taken off the truck except for color.
customer_reviews.author: JLWA

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal On These
customer_reviews.text: Got a great deal on these. When they're cheap, I stock up. Also use Purolator, I think they are very similar in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ramone

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the ones from past years
customer_reviews.text: The previous Bosch filter was Filtrete and had 99.9% efficiency, this new on only has 99%. This new one is 10x worse in filtering capability. But its still a good oil filter.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: have used this to change the oil in my honda pilot a number of times now. used to use the walmart generic (supertech) brand but can't find it anymore. price is good and filter looks high quality. I use all synthetic oil so i can run my engine idle for longer periods without fear of too much sludge forming. this combo seems to keep my car happy and huming. love the home delivery. subscribe and save would make this even better.
customer_reviews.author: penlight

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy removal.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money and easy to remove and install. I've used Bosch, Fram, and Mobile one oil filters for years and so for Bosch is the easiest to remove.
customer_reviews.author: geene dong

customer_reviews.title: Nice filter
customer_reviews.text: Normally I just get the Oil + Filter deal in the local auto parts stores. But, when the price is low, I order them from Amazon. It's a nice filter, used it on Honda Civic 2001. I hand tighten, then tighten 1/8 - 1/4 turn more. Haven't had issues.
customer_reviews.author: nieuport17

customer_reviews.title: great value with great quality
customer_reviews.text: been used it for last 4 oil changes. car runs great and without any issue. great value with quality compare many others.
customer_reviews.author: LL-TT

customer_reviews.title: cheap
customer_reviews.text: One big thing you can do for your car is change your oil regularly! It's quick and easy, even easier if you have some sort of drain valve installed. The oil filters are always going on sale so stuck on then.
customer_reviews.author: John le

customer_reviews.title: Good price, delivery time is iffy
customer_reviews.text: My only problem is that as an Amazon prime item, the delivery time this second time around was/is WAY longer than the first time. Otherwise, no complaints
customer_reviews.author: user 313

customer_reviews.title: Rugged US made filter
customer_reviews.text: I've used these Bosch 3233 for a few years, in my 2010 Civic, with 7000 mile oil changes and have not experienced any negative effects. The can is very sturdy and the the filter media seems to do it's job well.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like a good filter
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a good filter and looked to be built correctly, can’t tell if it’s better than anyone of my previous brands I’ve used but I had no problem installing! And my car runs perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BPUNZ Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Time to ditch fram filters
customer_reviews.text: They are great filter! I have used on Acura MDX and Honda Odyssey and Accord. Have had no issues with it. Much better and heavier than FRAM. It's a great OEM replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle_Feather

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Bosch3323
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and the price is right!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality filter
customer_reviews.text: This filter worked on my 2005 Mitsubishi Montero limited edition
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the 3323 on both our cars and my bike for two years with no issues. The filters are usually at least 2 bucks cheaper on Amazon then I can find them around town, so with a bit of planning I save a couple bucks on each oil change.
customer_reviews.author: UFeng

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This filter works as expected. It was easy to remove after using it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Oil Filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a good oil filter for Honda CRV 2011.
customer_reviews.author: duc le

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I saw these on sale and since my wife driver a lot and often, I figured I would pick up a few to last us through at least the next 6 - 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality oil filter
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I’ve been trusting Bosh oil filter for years!!! And the price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Chimin Jim

customer_reviews.title: 1999 Honda vfr800. Motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Bosch 3323 premium oil filters in my motorcycle for 8 years , never had a problem withe them , I've cut open used filters to look inside , the bosh are very well made compared to others , stay away from all fram filters , don't believe me ? Cut one open & take a look
customer_reviews.author: peter connor

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best filter on the market in it's price range for the Acura ... nothing else comes close including the factory filters.
customer_reviews.author: 4strokes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality for the price. Excellent replacement if you want an alternative to OE (original equipment) Filter.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Quality Filter
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's just an oil filter but it's quality at a good price... This part gets so underrated but it's a major key to long engine life.
customer_reviews.author: Tom F.

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: The only brand of oil filter I will use. Don't try to save a few pennies by buying off-brand filters. Bosch o ring is better.
customer_reviews.author: emma frye

customer_reviews.title: An oil filter to end all oil filters...
customer_reviews.text: This oil filter eats lightning and craps thunder. Actually, it's just an oil filter. It didn't fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Used on a 2015 Honda Odyssey and a 2005 Honda Accord. Good quality and fit.
customer_reviews.author: mkm

customer_reviews.title: Solid oil filter!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my 2012 Honda Fit, and it fits perfectly as it should. Seems like a quality filter. Usually use Mobile 1 filters, but by visual inspection they both seem comparable but at a more attractive price. Pretty happy with this purchase. Only time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: I previously used the Fram filter until I read an independent report that stated that microscopic bits of filter were found in the used oil.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Hood quality
customer_reviews.text: After watching video reviews on YouTube, I'm sticking to Bosch or Wix. Will never purchase the cheaper Fram filters that's available at Walmart
customer_reviews.author: Rylee

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this filter twice on Amazon and so far so good standard filter for 2000 Accord haven't any problems so far
customer_reviews.author: Eliseo Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Good fit on 2010 Nissan Titan
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2010 Nissan Titan very well. Protected my engine and was easy to install and later remove.
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: My number 1 filter
customer_reviews.text: Always use this filters on my 2011 Honda Fit. Perfect fit and great cleaning. I always trusted Bosch, great price also, pretty much u paying half a price for what they usually sell for.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Filter
customer_reviews.text: Filter went in fine. It's a bosch, so expecting great things, but it is still an oil filter and a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Good filter great price.. cant go wrong for your honda
customer_reviews.text: Just spun it on my 2007 saturn vue with a honda 3.5l v6. No leaking and suprise suprise its filtering oil.
customer_reviews.author: BowtieWill

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, arrived on time. What you expect from Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: bobteague2000

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable value.
customer_reviews.text: Good reputation for a filter. Assume it’s doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 95 Kia Sportage. Easy installation, and the slight extra cost was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DKnightSr

customer_reviews.title: Worth the higher price. Keeps engine clean
customer_reviews.text: Been using it on my Acura RSX type S for 8 years Replacind it every 5K-7K miles, car is smooth as butter after 232K miles on original engine no mods. Enough said
customer_reviews.author: Felix Durairaj

customer_reviews.title: Good brand.
customer_reviews.text: Bosch is one of those brands that has never left me down. The filter works just like oem but at a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lehner

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Did not have any problem of installing this product. Fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: MOINUL AFSER

product_meta.title: Bosch 3323 Premium FILTECH Oil Filter for Select Acura MDX, RDX, RSX, TL, Chrysler, Dodge, Ford, Honda Accord, Civic, CR-V, Pilot, Infiniti, Nissan + More
product_meta.description: Style:Premium| Size:3323Bosch Premium FILTECH Oil Filter provides superior oil filtration for increased engine protection. This oil filter, featuring Bosch FILTECH, utilizes an exclusive blend of natural and synthetic materials to provide superior oil filtration and increased engine wear protection. The Bosch FILTECH filtering area is up to 42 percent larger than conventional filters and the filter media is close to 30 percent thicker, and can screen out more harmful contaminants than a conventional filter.
feature_bullets: Bosch recommends the use of Castrol motor oil
Exclusive FILTECH media technology screens out more harmful contaminants for greater engine protection
Strong steel base plates and housings prevent warpage, leaks, and poor fit
Silicone anti-drainback valve ensures a supply of clean oil when the vehicle is started
High lubricity gasket design provides a tight seal, yet allows for easy removal

Acura: 06-11 CSX, 00-01 Integra, 03-18 MDX, 07-18 RDX, 04-14 TL; Honda: 00-18 Accord, 00-18 Civic, 00-18 CR-V, 07-19 Fit; Nissan: 98-06 Altima, 09-18 GT-R, 05-12 Pathfinder, 99-00 Quest, 00-06 Sentra, 16-18 Titan XD, 00-15 Xterra
